The Sc(1)-O(2) bond length is 2.13 Å. All Sc(1)-O(1) bond lengths are 2.11 Å. The Sc(1)-I(2) bond length is 2.89 Å. Both Sc(1)-I(1) bond lengths are 3.26 Å. In the second Sc site, Sc(2) is bonded in a 4-coordinate geometry to one O(1), three equivalent O(2), one I(2), and two equivalent I(1) atoms. The Sc(2)-O(1) bond length is 2.08 Å. There is one shorter (2.09 Å) and two longer (2.12 Å) Sc(2)-O(2) bond lengths. The Sc(2)-I(2) bond length is 2.90 Å. Both Sc(2)-I(1) bond lengths are 3.25 Å. There are two inequivalent O sites. In the first O site, O(1) is bonded to one Sc(2) and three equivalent Sc(1) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing OSc4 tetrahedra. In the second O site, O(2) is bonded to one Sc(1) and three equivalent Sc(2) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing OSc4 tetrahedra. There are two inequivalent I sites. In the first I site, I(1) is bonded in a 4-coordinate geometry to two equivalent Sc(1) and two equivalent Sc(2) atoms. In the second I site, I(2) is bonded in a distorted L-shaped geometry to one Sc(1) and one Sc(2) atom.

In the second Te site, Te(2) is bonded to four equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form a mixture of distorted edge and corner-sharing TeZr4 tetrahedra. In the third Te site, Te(3) is bonded in a 4-coordinate geometry to two equivalent Zr(1) and two equivalent Te(1) atoms.
